description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.

The Pixel Carrier Program Management team’s mission is to plan, deliver, and optimize Pixel Carrier approvals. Our team’s goal is to manage the process smoothly for the Pixel market, carriers, or in-market software releases, defining and delivering key program milestones to launch on-time with product excellence.

In this role, you will contribute excellent cross-functional program management skills to lead and resolve challenges across the carrier technical approvals work-stream, working with Partnerships, Product, Software, Hardware, Testing, and Operations teams. This role will be part of the Pixel program, a high-growth, faced-paced, and high-impact product program at Google.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, more powerful, and seamless. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, our Hardware team is making people's lives better through technology.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Experience in Software, Hardware, and/or Operational Program Management, leading and managing cross-functional programs throughout their lifecycle and in collaboration with stakeholders.
  • Experience in consumer hardware products (e.g., smartphones), hardware development, logistics, and/or consumer support.
  • Experience driving new product introduction or software releases for consumer electronics.
  • Experience in product experience and product excellence.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience or interest in cellular radio technologies and features such as 2G/3G/4G LTE, VoLTE, 4X4 MIMO, 5G, antenna design, etc., and their deployments among global cellular network operators/carriers.
  • Experience with industry standard certification bodies such as PTCRB and GCF.
  • Experience or interest in Android.
  • Experience working with partners or customers on integrated technology solutions.
  • Interest in smartphones, how they work, and how to make them better.
responsibilities:
• Define, lead, and drive schedules and milestones across Product Management, Go-To-Market (GTM), Software, Hardware, Carrier, and testing teams.
  • Collaborate with Software teams to effectively prioritize issues, triage bugs, land fixes, improve Carrier find/fix rate, and track Carrier market commitments release-over-release.
  • Advocate, produce, and refine process documentation. Seek opportunities to increase team efficiency and capacity/scale.
  • Align Carrier market and feature plan on record(POR). Lead and optimize Carrier testing coverage including first-party, third-party, field testing, and automation.
  • Define and optimize program working models between geographies and teams. Define and drive post-mortems to improve execution over time.
title: Pixel Carrier Program Manager
